meanings.definition: A boy or young man who serves as a personal attendant, especially in a royal or noble household.
meanings.sent1: The footboys assisted the king during his banquet.
meanings.sent2: The footboys carried the queen's train with grace.
meanings.sent3: The footboys joked and laughed while polishing the silverware.
meanings.sent4: The footboys were like shadows, always by the noble's side.
meanings.sent5: The footboys' loyalty was unwavering, a true mark of their dedication.

meanings.definition: A group of boys or young men who serve as attendants or servants.
meanings.sent1: The footboys lined up neatly to greet the guests.
meanings.sent2: The footboys worked together to set up the banquet hall.
meanings.sent3: The footboys raced each other to see who could serve the desserts faster.
meanings.sent4: The footboys moved in unison, a well-oiled machine of service.
meanings.sent5: The footboys' camaraderie was evident in their synchronized movements.

meanings.sent3: The family footboys were always busy running errands.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, the village would footboys to assist with chores.
meanings.sent5: To footboys efficiently, one must provide clear instructions and guidance.
